meanings.definition: To pack or store in a bushel.
meanings.sent1: She bushelled the apples in the basket for the market.
meanings.sent2: The farmer bushelled the grains in the storage shed.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel bushelled nuts in its cozy nest for winter.
meanings.sent4: He bushelled memories in his heart, each one carefully stored.
meanings.sent5: The children bushelled seashells along the shore, filling their pockets with treasures.

meanings.definition: To measure or deal out in bushels.
meanings.sent1: The grocer bushelled the potatoes for the customers.
meanings.sent2: She bushelled the corn to distribute evenly among the villagers.
meanings.sent3: The chef bushelled spices into the pot, creating a flavorful stew.
meanings.sent4: Time bushelled moments, each one a measure of a life lived.
meanings.sent5: The teacher bushelled out assignments to the students, ensuring fairness in distribution.
